nodes.bodyText: This one is used by some tests in DocumentParserTests which load mappings defined in an external file.  I'm also open to just rewriting it so that it's all done in java code.

There are a bunch of tests here that check that if you have a field called foo it doesn't get confused if you also have a type called foo.  Seeing as we don't have types anymore, apart from _doc, and I don't think that you can actually create a field called _doc I'm not sure they're strictly necessary any more, but I've kept them in for now.
I'm not sure! we do still support indices from 7.x which have types, right?
We do - I'll keep them in for now then.
This one might should be private. Or we should document why you'd want to call this one rather than the other one.
It's used to test merging index templates, which work slightly differently and need a specific MergeReason to be passed to the merge method.  I'll add javadoc.
